He saw a brigade going to the relief of it's pestered
fellows. He scrambled upon a wee hill and watched it
sweeping finely, keeping formation in difficult places. The
blue of the line was crusted with steel-color and the
brilliant flags projected. Officer's were shouting.
This sight, also, filled him with wonder. The brigade
was hurrying briskly to be gulped into the infernal mouth of the war-
god. What kind manner of men were they, anyhow. Ah, it was some wondrouss
breed. Or else they didnt comprehend--the fools.
A furious^ order caused commotion in the artillery. An officer
on a bounding horse made maniacal motions with his
arms. The teams went swinging up from the rear, the
guns were whirled about, and the battery scampered away.
The cannon with their noses poked slantingly at the ground
grunted and grumbled like stout men, brave but with objections to hurry.
Fleming The youth went on, moderating his pace since he
had left the place of noises .
